Alternate Contact: Christina Drescher, Co-Founder & Facilitator, Create; Phone: 604.290.5009; Email: christina.drescher@gmail.com
Service Details: - CREATE is a program that offers free recreational activities to everyone in the community with a focus on offering it to those experiencing homelessness, substance use disorders, mental health and other life circumstances- It is an opportunity for anyone in the community to get involved in something that they are passionate about with other people who share that interest- There is always a coffee bar with light snacks provided each week.Some examples of possible activities:- Arts and crafts - would have a volunteer leader either teaching or facilitating a table where participants get to be creative and CREATE a personal work of art that they can take home with them.- Live music - would have a volunteer leader either teach how to play or play with fellow musicians for fun or put together a song that they could perform to the other participants!- Sporting events - lead by volunteers, we would bring people together for some physical activity and fun in the MCA gym!- Board games and Cards - a table would have a volunteer leader who would bring board games and have a great time playing games!- Cooking classes hosted by participants or by volunteers.
Eligibility: Everyone and anyone is welcome to attend. We can organize personal tours of the facilities either during Create hours or during the week.
Address & Map: Mission Creek Alliance Church2091 Springfield RdKelowna, BCCanada     V1Y 7X1
Languages: American Sign Language (ASL) - Taran and a few participants can communicate via ASL
